koolkristine

I am Pro-Choice and I want you all to take a look at this thought -
 
 Many teenagers get pregnant..many times on accident. You can take protecion and still get pregnant, you can be raped(and maybe never report it but it was still rape), or maybe just make a stupid mistake(teenage years are the time to learn from your mistakes). But if a teenager does get pregnant and abortion is not an option because it is outlawed then they will, of course, have to go through with the birth. Then, what happens to the baby? The teenager may decide to keep the baby, but think about how this childs life will be with a teenage parent! It will not be a good life! The teenager will most likely not have enough money or time or effort to support the child into a good life. Don't you think it would be better then to get rid of the child before it has to go through that life? The teenager may also put the baby up for adoption. Living in that adoption center or in a foster home is not the life for anyone. Again, dont you want to save this un-born child from this kind of horrible life? Also, dont you want to save the teenager from the life of a teenage parent? 
 
 Another thought - 
 
 The fetus is never born, it will never know what its like to be living in the world, so you shouldn't be so worried about it!
 
 Last thought -
 
 Its a girls body...let her CHOOSE what she wants to do with it! It is her baby too! You gave women the right to choose when giving them the right to vote, give them the right to choose with abortion as well!

post_info.post_title: Think about the un-born child...please read!

zachvac

I totally agree. I think that people who use the argument of "you're killing a potential life" are totally wrong. Are they going to force them to have sex so the potential for a life is there? I don't know of anyone who has that opinion yet.
GreenMtnBoy

Or how about what actions people would take if abortion was illegal. Instead of going to a respectable doctor's office, they'd goto a two bit hack with iffy training and unsterile tools. Or even worse, they'd try to do it themselves, like throwing themselves down a flight of stairs, etc.
 
 Also, a fetus isn't a child. A child can live without it's mother. A fetus cannot. We don't see a fetus as a parasite, but that essentially what it is.....

Also, a fetus isn't a child. A child can live without it's mother. A fetus cannot. We don't see a fetus as a parasite, but that essentially what it is.....

 Is the child still a parasite then?
jim's trucking

That argument could be used to justify killing all unborn children. There's a possibility that both parents could be killed in a car wreck on the way home from the hospital. What if the parents divorce when the child is one week old? Don't you want to save the child from having to grow up without parents?
 emoticon_rolleyes 
 
 Abortion is nothing short of MURDER!
 
 There are couples who would love to have children but can't. Give them a chance to adopt.
JakeCJB

It's true that newborn babies are also dependent in many ways. However, the newborn baby is not exclusively dependent on the woman's own body for survival, unlike the fetus. The vast majority of fetuses aborted, do not have human sentience, unlike the baby.
 
 An analogy to a parasite or a tumour is not such a bad one, unless you romanticize the fetus as a potential human person.
 
 If it's nothing short of murder Jim's trucking, should women who spontaneously abort be charged with involuntary manslaughter of a potential human person? Should men be charged with murdering a potential person when they masturbate?
 
 Given that two-thirds of all human conceptions are spontaneously aborted, we should be doing a lot more mourning for all those potential persons, gone.
 
 Also, if women choose to have a baby, and give it to an adoption agency, fine. But women aren't mindless breeding stock for others. Women can make their own choices.

Should men be charged with murdering a potential person when they masturbate?
No.

If the mother's health is endangered by the pregnancy or the potential birth, I say abort. If not, have the baby and deal with the consequences...either take care of it or give it to someone who will.

 What if we're not talking late term?

The age old question begs to be asked again. Where do you draw the line?

IMO somewhere around the end of the first trimester. Would you consider taking the "morning after" pill murder?
No. A prevention of pregnancy is not the same as ending one that has commenced.
 
 I've used condoms, foam, sponges, withdrawal and abstinence to prevent pregnancies. I can't see killing something that has already started growing in the womb just because you don't want the little bastard.
 
 Why do you pick the end of the first trimester?
zachvac

People say after they're born they're dependant on the mother. That's not true. A baby can survive without their mother. zachvac

How is it more? I said the only thing different was it had the potential for life. It's part of the woman's body and she should have as much right to get rid of it as she does a toenail. It's part of her body until it's born. After that though it is a human.
Sigma

The age old question begs to be asked again. Where do you draw the line?

 
 Er... birth!
jim's trucking

How is it more? I said the only thing different was it had the potential for life. It's part of the woman's body and she should have as much right to get rid of it as she does a toenail. It's part of her body until it's born. After that though it is a human.
It is not part of her body. It is a separate body, protected inside and connected to its hosting mother's body by an umbilical cord which carries nourishment in blood. After a time, it has its own beating heart and its own breathing lungs. It is entirely different from a lifeless toenail.
Sigma

It is not part of her body. It is a separate body, protected inside and connected to its hosting mother's body by an umbilical cord which carries nourishment in blood. After a time, it has its own beating heart and its own breathing lungs. It is entirely different from a lifeless toenail.

 
 How about another organ, which is alive? How about the mitochondria organelle, which has it's own, separate, DNA?
 
 The fetus' organs do not function, or function imperfectly. It uses the mother's organs to perform essential life-functions. It is, in essence, merged with the mother and both are using her organs. In that sense, it is a part of the woman. The fetus' heart does not function as a born person's heart beats, and the fetus' lungs do not function at all until it takes it's first breath. It does not have a separate body, because it uses the woman's.
jim's trucking

How about another organ, which is alive? How about the mitochondria organelle, which has it's own, separate, DNA?
 
 The fetus' organs do not function, or function imperfectly. It uses the mother's organs to perform essential life-functions. It is, in essence, merged with the mother and both are using her organs. In that sense, it is a part of the woman. The fetus' heart does not function as a born person's heart beats, and the fetus' lungs do not function at all until it takes it's first breath. It does not have a separate body, because it uses the woman's.
We're getting into areas where my expertise is lacking. However, I do know that the heart begins to beat quite early in fetal development...long before birth.
 
 The fact that the unborn child is receiving life-giving functions through the umbilical cord does not mean that it is part of the mother's body. There are no connections to the mother's brain, she cannot feel pain that might be inflicted on the child's body.
 
 ...
Sigma

We're getting into areas where my expertise is lacking. However, I do know that the heart begins to beat quite early in fetal development...long before birth.

 
 I fail to see why that matters. A beating heart does not make the creature a person. If you don't know the details, should you really be forcing your view on other people?
 
 

 The fact that the unborn child is receiving life-giving functions through the umbilical cord does not mean that it is part of the mother's body. There are no connections to the mother's brain, she cannot feel pain that might be inflicted on the child's body.
 

 
 Since when does the ability to feel pain make something a part of your body? If it is numb is it any less a part of you? 
 
 Heck, the fetus' brain isn't even developed enough to feel pain until at least the 3rd trimester (according to most scientists). Will that make you change your stance on abortion? Unlikely. 
 
 The fact that the "unborn child" (makes me think "undead corpse" whenever I see or type that) is receiving life-giving functions through the unbilical cord means that the creature on the other end gets to decide whether or not she will continue in the life-support function she is in.
zachvac

It is not part of her body. It is a separate body, protected inside and connected to its hosting mother's body by an umbilical cord which carries nourishment in blood. After a time, it has its own beating heart and its own breathing lungs. It is entirely different from a lifeless toenail.

 
 A toenail grows just like the baby, but totally dependant on the mother. Basically, if when the mother dies, something dies, then the something is totally dependant and part of the mother. A toenail quits growing when a mother dies, and a baby quits growing into a real human when the mother dies. When the baby is born it's not part of the mother and if the mother died, the father could take care of it, or it could be adopted, or so many other possibilities.
Sigma

A toenail grows just like the baby, but totally dependant on the mother. Basically, if when the mother dies, something dies, then the something is totally dependant and part of the mother. A toenail quits growing when a mother dies, and a baby quits growing into a real human when the mother dies. When the baby is born it's not part of the mother and if the mother died, the father could take care of it, or it could be adopted, or so many other possibilities.

 
 Actually, toenails continue to grow after the person dies :p Imagine having to cut the nails of a dead person
jim's trucking

Actually, toenails continue to grow after the person dies :p Imagine having to cut the nails of a dead person
So does hair, but the product is still dead material.
kickin50

If not, have the baby and deal with the consequences...either take care of it or give it to someone who will.
Adoption would NEVER be an option for me. I couldn't live with myself if I ever dumped my baby on strangers. Adoptive parents who want babies don't make them good parents. They could be sickos for all I know. So -- the only valid "someone" is the father. How about we cut the whole legal process short (child support and all) and just draw straws for it. Dad's -- how about you take just a 50% chance at being the one to do the diapers and the bottles and find the day care and explain to your boss why you can't work late. All I ever see is fathers who go on about their regular lives and complain about a little food money for the kid.
OccamsRazor

Adoption would NEVER be an option for me. I couldn't live with myself if I ever dumped my baby on strangers. Adoptive parents who want babies don't make them good parents. They could be sickos for all I know.

 
 Are you for real? do you have any idea about the sort of circumstances that might leave a couple facing the option of adoption? Do you know how difficult it is to actually adopt a child?
kickin50

Are you for real? do you have any idea about the sort of circumstances that might leave a couple facing the option of adoption? Do you know how difficult it is to actually adopt a child?
I'm absolutely for real. That's how I feel -- and I'm probably not alone. I absolutely understand the heart break of people who can't have kids. There was a year when I thought I was in that group. Luckily, our condition was easily curable. I feel for them. But I can't give them mine. My child could spend a lifetime in a situation that I don't approve of. "Good" people could teach them to be racists or well, just on and on and on. Heaven only knows what. Parenting is more than food and bed time and homework - it's raising a child to turn into a good adult. Since one person's view of a good adult can differ dramatically from another person's, I could never leave that to someone else.
koolkristine

Seems the argument has moved to...is the fetus really a child and living thing that you are "killing" or is it like a toenail or parasite?
 I personally believe that the fetus is not something that should be known as a person until it is born. The fetus is part of the women...it is inside of her and using her to grow. I think the best thing I read in these posts is comparing "unborn child" to an "undead corpse" ...so true!!!
 
 Another thing I have thought of. Government can NOT make a law telling people what they can and can not do to their bodies. They can't make tatoos or piercings illegel...why can they make abortion legal? Yes, they can make doing drugs(which is technically doing something to your own body) illegal but that is in the case that while you are on drugs or alcohal then you can endanger another persons life. Abortion will not endanger another persons life. It will only rid a women of a POTENTIAL child and not hurt anybody else in the process. It is all POTENTIAL not a real person yet. 
 
 Also...women that get abortion may do so only for her unborn childs sake. She probaly knows that she will not be able to take care of the child and doesn't want to bring it into the world...especially with the horrible place our world has become.
pickleweaseler

Another thing I have thought of. Government can NOT make a law telling people what they can and can not do to their bodies. They can't make tatoos or piercings illegel...why can they make abortion legal?

 
 Why do you think the government can't regulate what we do to our own bodies?
Kamandi

Actually, toenails continue to grow after the person dies :p Imagine having to cut the nails of a dead person

 - Actually, that's an urban legend: they don't continue to grow. the skin around them just shrinks, making it look like they grew.
 
 www.snopes.com/science/nailgrow.asp
Kamandi

Why do you think the government can't regulate what we do to our own bodies?

 - Something often referred to as "the constitutional right to privacy."
faeden

Obviously, if some people recognize a fetus as a form of human life, then killing it is as wrong as killing any other human for any reason. If some others DON'T recognize a fetus (unborn) as a form of human life, then a woman's regulation of her own body (to abort or not) can't be challenged.
 
 IMO, there is no grey area in this debate. Both positions are logical and rational. However, I believe there are many who have reservations about aborting a pregnency. It seems to me that those people are making life and death decisions based on the opinion/rational of only one of the two people involved. Who are we - any of us - to prejudge the value/worth/sucess of an innocent life based on our own fears or worries. Should all minority children be aborted because they will probably suffer from discrimination and/or poverty? Of course not!
 
 Here's another analogy to ponder...... Many environmentalists decry the destruction of the rain forests because there may be undiscovered plants/animals/cures ect. that may never be discovered because of the destruction of those things before their WORTH can be realized. BUT WAIT! What if the baby that is aborted today would eventually make that valuable discovery/contribution?
 
 To those pro-choice folks. You are on firm ground in your position, if you believe that life does not begin until birth. I urge you to consider that that very bedrock of your position could be false. I wonder if my bedrock belief is also flawed, but even if I am wrong, no one dies.

jim's trucking

The polite way to refer to a pregnant woman years ago was "with child". There's a child (or more) growing in the womb of every pregnant female (expectant MOTHER). She's expecting a child to be issued. While there is no such thing as an undead corpse, there certainly are quite a few unborn children. (These are just children who haven't been born yet.)

(He had an eyelid and lower lip "decorated" with stainless steel balls.) The school board concluded he was a major distraction.

- Actually, that's an urban legend: they don't continue to grow. the skin around them just shrinks, making it look like they grew.

Sigma

Obviously, if some people recognize a fetus as a form of human life, then killing it is as wrong as killing any other human for any reason. If some others DON'T recognize a fetus (unborn) as a form of human life, then a woman's regulation of her own body (to abort or not) can't be challenged.

 
 Most people recognize the fetus as a form of life. I don't know where you get this from. It is not considered a person under the law.
 
 

 IMO, there is no grey area in this debate. Both positions are logical and rational. However, I believe there are many who have reservations about aborting a pregnency. It seems to me that those people are making life and death decisions based on the opinion/rational of only one of the two people involved. Who are we - any of us - to prejudge the value/worth/sucess of an innocent life based on our own fears or worries. Should all minority children be aborted because they will probably suffer from discrimination and/or poverty? Of course not!

 
 Eh? Why did you suddenly start with forcing abortions? Who in the world wants to do that? Certainly no-one who is pro-choice.
 
 Both positions may have logic, but the pro-life side is a lot more cruel and oppressive, imo. To use your words, who are we - any of us - to force a woman to continue a pregnancy that she does not want? Who are we to tell a woman "Deal with it" with a pregnancy that, to her, she has good reasons not to continue? That is evil and oppressive, imo.
 
 

 Here's another analogy to ponder...... Many environmentalists decry the destruction of the rain forests because there may be undiscovered plants/animals/cures ect. that may never be discovered because of the destruction of those things before their WORTH can be realized.  It doesn't matter, if it is inside her body and she does not want it there, it is getting out. 
 
 

 To those pro-choice folks. You are on firm ground in your position, if you believe that life does not begin until birth. I urge you to consider that that very bedrock of your position could be false. I wonder if my bedrock belief is also flawed, but even if I am wrong, no one dies.

The polite way to refer to a pregnant woman years ago was "with child". There's a child (or more) growing in the womb of every pregnant female (expectant MOTHER). She's expecting a child to be issued. While there is no such thing as an undead corpse, there certainly are quite a few unborn children. (These are just children who haven't been born yet.)

 
 Yes, that is/was the PC way of saying it. In an abortion debate, we are arguing legal aspects, medical aspects, biologic aspects, etc. To use correct terms for different stages of development and that have boundaries (such as birth) it is easier to debate. Using emotional terms like "babies" does not contribute to the debate and is dishonest debating, imo.
